item.title: #en @ 1522606073126998017
item.description: Next week, I want to have a discussion on #OpenScience and how we can use it within the lab I work in. If anyone has a short introductory presentation (5-10 slides max) to what open science is and what behaviors are part of it (e.g. open data, prereg..), I'd love to see it! üòä

item.title: #en @ 1522586917744910336
item.description:
Open data can make research more publicly accessible and accountable - often associated w quant datasets.
It can be trickier to make qual datasets publicly available (risks to participant privacy, etc).
We've been experimenting w an open data QUAL project @redetranscanada:

item.title: #en @ 1522337320569090048
item.description:
1) many osf pages were still private. Though access was requested, it was rarely given. This doesn't seem like open data.
2) one study have scripts, and when trying to recreate the results there were very different results.
What are the best ways forward?

item.title: #en @ 1522337046265798656
item.description:
I assigned my students to go to Psych Science (last 3 years) and pick a study with open data. Then run the authors' analyses and see if they can reproduce them.
Everyone seemed to enjoy it! Most cases everything was fine would recommend for other methods classes!
2 issues: 1/2
